name: Prima City Hotel Tel Aviv

reviews.text: We stayed there for two days. The room size was ok, though the bed and toilets were small. Breakfast is less generous than breakfast of other Israeli hotels. It was convenient that the hotel has private parking and the hotel offers bicycle, which is very useful in Tel Aviv.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Our relative had wedding in August 2008 year in Tel-Aviv city, our family (4 people) first time stayed at this hotel. We found randomly this hotel by internet. And we really fell in love in this hotel. And after this moment, every year when we arrived to Israel we stay at City hotel. In November 2012 when we stayed at this hotel fifth time we were satisfy oneself that every year it becomes much and much better. We like big shiny rooms, teapot with all ingredients you need, big bath. Every day they put new soap in bath, clean towels. Very clean rooms. Especially we would like to make a point on restaurant - even though it's kosher you have plenty of different and tasty food. Special thanks I would like to say great thanks to manager of the restaurant who every morning greetings you with a huge smile on his face. Also hotel has big (free!!!) parking, and its located nearby the see which is also great. Also want to say thank you to reception guys. They're great!!! An at last our visit our room was not clean yet, and Alexandra (reception worker) gives us a free lunch.
reviews.title: Best hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: P.S. In conclusion I want to say that this hotel is really good and we will stop there next year enventually. We will advise this hotel to our friends for sure.
reviews.title: One night stay in TLV

reviews.text: With respect, Frenkel and Litvak family.
reviews.title: Incredible service

reviews.text: Very very pleased with this hotel and its service. We got a free upgrade to a bigger room with an ocean view. The room was clean and modern. Breakfast had a great selection and was very tasty. AMAZING location- we parked our car upon arrival (in the FREE parking lot) and didn't need to use during our stay.
reviews.title: well placed hotel. Good service and staff. Food nice . comfortable

reviews.text: I stayed at The City Hotel Tel Aviv January 25-28th, 2013...it was my first stay there.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The staff was pretty good & the breakfasts were good too. The room was ample sized, was clean, had a double bed & a refrigerator, and I was lucky to have a room w/a sea view. At night when it was quiet I could hear the waves on the sea from my bed. The location was great since its about half way between Allenby & Arlozorov. Lots of restaurants around & only about 1 1/2 blocks to the beach.
reviews.title: just what you need but NOTHING more

reviews.text: The rate I got was $120/night.....and while I would always like to see it cheaper ....I was in a room around the corner at another hotel that was half the size w/a single bed for $110/night.
reviews.title: Return to the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay there again & would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been for many times at the Tal Hotel (same chain) and I was sufficiently satisfied so I wanted to check out this hotel to see if at the price of being slightly farther from the beach (which unfortunately coming here for business I do not get the chance to enjoy), I could get a newer hotel at the same price.
reviews.title: Convenient and Confortable

reviews.text: Refurbished in modern IKEA style. Perfectly suitable and well priced for location. Very good breakfast and friendly/helpful staff. Only gripe was their offer for complimentary airport transport with a three-night stay. As a family of four, we booked two rooms for two nights = four room nights. The manager/owner would not honor the offer or listen to reason.
reviews.title: Good Hotel For A Short Stay

reviews.text: This very special little hotel located just 100 meters from the beach is a jewel in Tel Aviv. The hotel rooms have everything you need- This is my second stay here- the rooms are comfortable, bright, the closets hold exactly what you need- there is a fridge and a safe. Everything works and looks good and new. The bathroom is spacious and functional. What I enjoy about this place: the rooms are bright, the staff is very nice, helpful and always the same- (the same I met two years ago)- So you feel like part of a family. Breakfast is terrific: several types of fish, cheeses, cereal, many, many fresh fruits, several delicious breads to choose from, excellent coffees and teas. If you have breakfast here a little late you don't need to eat for another 8 hours. And the price is very fair for what they offer you and in the lower range of the hotel prices in Tel Aviv. I wouldn't mind living here for a long time!
reviews.title: My home away from home in Tel Aviv

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cant really criticise this hotel at all. It is nice and clean.
reviews.title: basic but nice

reviews.text: It is basic and not at all luxurious but essentially says what it does on the tin.
reviews.title: Friendly and well locade hotel

reviews.text: Staff were polite as well. If you are on a budget as hotels in Tel Aviv are expensive then worth booking. If you can splash out a bit more then I would.
reviews.title: an amazing stay in a friendly great location hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 6 days. This is the third time in this hotel. We will definitely come again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel. Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The underground Garage is awesome!!
reviews.title: 12 Night Stay and a 14 Day Stay
Great choice
reviews.text: The staff is very friendly.

reviews.title: Hope you'll fix wifi :)
reviews.text: The location is great. near the sea. from about half o the rooms there is a sea view.

I have had the pleasure of staying at Atlas City Hotel twice in 3 years. The first time was for 14 days after my Taglit trip ended, and the next was in March of 2013 for 12 days during Pesach. Both times the staff was always incredibly helpful and the place was spotless. My first stay had a bigger room than my current one but all in all it remained incredibly high value. The breakfast in the morning is great and has tons of choices. Please be aware during holidays such as Pesach/Passover the hotel is kosher. I would like to give praise to Norbert and Alfonso for being incredibly helpful and making my two stays pleasant. This is my go to hotel for staying in Tel Aviv.
reviews.title: A good place to stay

description: The City Hotel is for tourists and businesspeople who want to fully experience the dynamic city of Tel Aviv. The hotel is centrally located in the heart of the city’s tourism and business district and a short walk from the city’s most popular leisure spot – the expansive Mediterranean beaches – many of its guestrooms offer a gorgeous view of the sea. The Hotel has 96 guestrooms, 24 of which have private balconies and all of which are equipped with a direct dial phone with voice mail, free wi-fi access, Flatt Screen TV, a mini-fridge and coffee and tea facilities, and a personal safe. the Hotel offers a wide range of services and facilities to make guests comfortable. They include free parking, rich Israeli breakfast, attentive room service, a lobby lounge with free wi-fi access, a free internet station, and a charming outdoor coffee shop. A gym is available in a nearby location for a moderate charge.
